data PolicyAttributeTypeDescription

-- | <a>PolicyAttributeTypeDescription</a> constructor.

-- | The name of the attribute.

-- | The type of the attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or
--   <a>Integer</a>.
patdAttributeType :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The cardinality of the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   ONE(1) : Single value required ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value can
--   be supplied ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed
--   ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed
patdCardinality :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The default value of the attribute, if applicable.
patdDefaultValue :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the attribute.
patdDescription :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)
data HealthCheck

-- | <a>HealthCheck</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>hcHealthyThreshold</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>hcInterval</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>hcTarget</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>hcTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>hcUnhealthyThreshold</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
healthCheck :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> HealthCheck

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the instance to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
hcHealthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
hcInterval :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS,
--   or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   <a>TCP:5000</a>. In this case, a health check simply attempts to open
--   a TCP connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to
--   connect within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80<i>weather</i>us<i>wa</i>seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET
--   request is issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any
--   answer other than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered
--   unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
hcTarget :: Lens' HealthCheck Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
hcTimeout :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the instance to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
hcUnhealthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural
data CrossZoneLoadBalancing

-- | <a>CrossZoneLoadBalancing</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>czlbEnabled</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
crossZoneLoadBalancing :: Bool -> CrossZoneLoadBalancing

-- | Specifies whether cross-zone load balancing is enabled for the load
--   balancer.
czlbEnabled :: Lens' CrossZoneLoadBalancing Bool
data LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | <a>LoadBalancerAttributes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lbaAccessLog</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>AccessLog</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbaAdditionalAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>AdditionalAttribute</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lbaConnectionDraining</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ConnectionDraining</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbaConnectionSettings</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ConnectionSettings</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbaCrossZoneLoadBalancing</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>CrossZoneLoadBalancing</a></li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerAttributes :: LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all
--   requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you
--   specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Elastic
--   Load BalancingDeveloper Guide</i>.
lbaAccessLog :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe AccessLog)

-- | This parameter is reserved.
lbaAdditionalAttributes :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes [AdditionalAttribute]

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete
--   before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or
--   unhealthy back-end instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Elastic LoadBalancing Developer Guide</i>.
lbaConnectionDraining :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionDraining)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle
--   (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>ElasticLoad Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
lbaConnectionSettings :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionSettings)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across
--   all back-end instances regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a> in
--   the <i>ElasticLoad Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
lbaCrossZoneLoadBalancing :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing)
data AccessLog

-- | <a>AccessLog</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>alEmitInterval</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>alEnabled</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>alS3BucketName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>alS3BucketPrefix</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
accessLog :: Bool -> AccessLog

-- | The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
alEmitInterval :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether access log is enabled for the load balancer.
alEnabled :: Lens' AccessLog Bool

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
alS3BucketName :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example 'my-bucket-prefix/prod'. If the prefix is not provided, the
--   log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
alS3BucketPrefix :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

listenerDescription :: ListenerDescription

-- | The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.

data LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | <a>LBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lbcspCookieExpirationPeriod</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>

--   </ul>
lbcookieStickinessPolicy :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
lbcspCookieExpirationPeriod :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name for the policy being created. The name must be unique within
--   the set of policies for this load balancer.
lbcspPolicyName :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Text)

data LoadBalancerDescription

-- | <a>LoadBalancerDescription</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:

--   <li><a>lbdLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbdPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Policies</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbdScheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>

--   <li><a>lbdSourceSecurityGroup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>SourceSecurityGroup</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbdSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lbdVPCId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerDescription :: LoadBalancerDescription

-- | The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
lbdAvailabilityZones :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [Text]

-- | Information about the back-end servers.
lbdBackendServerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [BackendServerDescription]

-- | The Amazon Route 53 hosted zone associated with the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Domain Names With Elastic Load
--   Balancing</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
lbdCanonicalHostedZoneName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone name associated with the
--   load balancer.
lbdCanonicalHostedZoneNameID :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the load balancer was created.
lbdCreatedTime :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The external DNS name of the load balancer.
lbdDNSName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.
lbdHealthCheck :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe HealthCheck)

-- | The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.
lbdInstances :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [Instance]

-- | The listeners for the load balancer.
lbdListenerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [ListenerDescription]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
lbdLoadBalancerName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The policies defined for the load balancer.
lbdPolicies :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Policies)

-- | The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is 'internet-facing', the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
lbdScheme :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load
--   balancers in a VPC.
lbdSecurityGroups :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [Text]

-- | The security group that you can use as part of your inbound rules for
--   your load balancer's back-end application instances. To only allow
--   traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule to your back
--   end instance that specifies this source security group as the inbound
--   source.
lbdSourceSecurityGroup :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe SourceSecurityGroup)

-- | The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
lbdSubnets :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription [Text]

-- | The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.
lbdVPCId :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

data ConnectionSettings

-- | <a>ConnectionSettings</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csIdleTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
connectionSettings :: Natural -> ConnectionSettings

-- | The time, in seconds, that the connection is allowed to be idle (no
--   data has been sent over the connection) before it is closed by the
--   load balancer.
csIdleTimeout :: Lens' ConnectionSettings Natural
data PolicyTypeDescription

-- | <a>PolicyTypeDescription</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   </ul>
policyTypeDescription :: PolicyTypeDescription

-- | A description of the policy type.
ptdDescription :: Lens' PolicyTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the policy attributes associated with the policies
--   defined by Elastic Load Balancing.
ptdPolicyAttributeTypeDescriptions :: Lens' PolicyTypeDescription [PolicyAttributeTypeDescription]

-- | The name of the policy type.
ptdPolicyTypeName :: Lens' PolicyTypeDescription (Maybe Text)
data Policies

-- | <a>Policies</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pAppCookieStickinessPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>AppCookieStickinessPolicy</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>pLBCookieStickinessPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>LBCookieStickinessPolicy</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>pOtherPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
policies :: Policies

-- | The stickiness policies created using
--   <tt>CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy</tt>.
pAppCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies [AppCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The stickiness policies created using
--   <tt>CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy</tt>.
pLBCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies [LBCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The policies other than the stickiness policies.
pOtherPolicies :: Lens' Policies [Text]
data Listener

-- | <a>Listener</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lInstancePort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>lInstanceProtocol</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lLoadBalancerPort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>lProtocol</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lSSLCertificateId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listener :: Text -> Int -> Natural -> Listener

-- | The port on which the instance server is listening - 25, 80, 443, 465,
--   587, or 1024-65535.
lInstancePort :: Lens' Listener Natural

-- | The protocol to use for routing traffic to back-end instances: HTTP,
--   HTTPS, TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL,
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be at the same protocol.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
lInstanceProtocol :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The port on which the load balancer is listening: 25, 80, 443, 465,
--   587, or 1024-65535.
lLoadBalancerPort :: Lens' Listener Int

-- | The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
lProtocol :: Lens' Listener Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.
lSSLCertificateId :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)
data ConnectionDraining

-- | <a>ConnectionDraining</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdEnabled</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
connectionDraining :: Bool -> ConnectionDraining

-- | Specifies whether connection draining is enabled for the load
--   balancer.
cdEnabled :: Lens' ConnectionDraining Bool

-- | The maximum time, in seconds, to keep the existing connections open
--   before deregistering the instances.
cdTimeout :: Lens' ConnectionDraining (Maybe Int)
data InstanceState

-- | <a>InstanceState</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>isDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>isInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>isReasonCode</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>isState</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
instanceState :: InstanceState

-- | A description of the instance state. This string can contain one or
--   more of the following messages.
--   
--   'N/A'
--   
--   'A transient error occurred. Please try again later.'
--   
--   'Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   healthchecks consecutively.'
--   
--   'Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold number of
--   healthchecks consecutively.'
--   
--   'Instance registration is still in progress.'
--   
--   'Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which LoadBalancer is
--   notconfigured to route traffic to.'
--   
--   'Instance is not currently registered with the LoadBalancer.'
--   
--   'Instance deregistration currently in progress.'
--   
--   'Disable Availability Zone is currently in progress.'
--   
--   'Instance is in pending state.'
--   
--   'Instance is in stopped state.'
--   
--   'Instance is in terminated state.'
isDescription :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the instance.
isInstanceId :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <a>ELB</a> | <a>Instance</a> | 'N/A'
isReasonCode :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
isState :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)
data TagKeyOnly

-- | <a>TagKeyOnly</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tkoKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
tagKeyOnly :: TagKeyOnly

-- | The name of the key.
tkoKey :: Lens' TagKeyOnly (Maybe Text)
data Instance

-- | <a>Instance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>iInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
instance' :: Instance

-- | The ID of the instance.
iInstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

instance AWSService ELB


-- | Associates, updates, or disables a policy with a listener for the
--   specified load balancer. You can associate multiple policies with a
--   listener.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>slbpolLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbpolLoadBalancerPort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbpolPolicyNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener :: Text -> Int -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener

-- | The name of the load balancer.
slbpolLoadBalancerName :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener Text

-- | The external port of the load balancer for the policy.
slbpolLoadBalancerPort :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener Int

-- | The names of the policies. If the list is empty, the current policy is
--   removed from the listener.
slbpolPolicyNames :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener [Text]
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse</a> constructor.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Eq SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance Ord SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance Read SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance Show SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance Eq SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Ord SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Read SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Show SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Generic SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Datatype D1SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
instance AWSRequest SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance ToHeaders SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance ToQuery SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
instance ToPath SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener


-- | Replaces the set of policies associated with the specified port on
--   which the back-end server is listening with a new set of policies. At
--   this time, only the back-end server authentication policy type can be
--   applied to the back-end ports; this policy type is composed of
--   multiple public key policies.
--   
--   Each time you use <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer</a> to
--   enable the policies, use the <tt>PolicyNames</tt> parameter to list
--   the policies that you want to enable.
--   
--   You can use <tt>DescribeLoadBalancers</tt> or
--   <tt>DescribeLoadBalancerPolicies</tt> to verify that the policy is
--   associated with the back-end server.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>slbpfbsInstancePort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbpfbsLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbpfbsPolicyNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer :: Text -> Int -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer

-- | The port number associated with the back-end server.
slbpfbsInstancePort :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer Int

-- | The name of the load balancer.
slbpfbsLoadBalancerName :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer Text

-- | The names of the policies. If the list is empty, then all current
--   polices are removed from the back-end server.
slbpfbsPolicyNames :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer [Text]
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse</a> constructor.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Eq SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance Ord SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance Read SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance Show SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance Eq SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Ord SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Read SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Show SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Generic SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Datatype D1SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse
instance AWSRequest SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance ToHeaders SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance ToQuery SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
instance ToPath SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer


-- | Sets the certificate that terminates the specified listener's SSL
--   connections. The specified certificate replaces any prior certificate
--   that was used on the same load balancer and port.
--   
--   For more information about updating your SSL certificate, see
--   <a>Updating anSSL Certificate for a Load Balancer</a> in the
--   <i>Elastic Load Balancing DeveloperGuide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate
data SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>slblsslcLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>slblsslcLoadBalancerPort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>slblsslcSSLCertificateId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
setLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate :: Text -> Int -> Text -> SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate

-- | The name of the load balancer.
slblsslcLoadBalancerName :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate Text

-- | The port that uses the specified SSL certificate.
slblsslcLoadBalancerPort :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL certificate.
slblsslcSSLCertificateId :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate Text
data SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificateResponse

-- | <a>SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificateResponse</a> constructor.
setLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificateResponse :: SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificateResponse

instance Ord SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate

-- | Removes one or more tags from the specified load balancer.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_RemoveTags.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.RemoveTags
data RemoveTags

-- | <a>RemoveTags</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtLoadBalancerNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rtTags</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>NonEmpty</a> <a>TagKeyOnly</a></li>
--   </ul>
removeTags :: NonEmpty TagKeyOnly -> RemoveTags

-- | The name of the load balancer. You can specify a maximum of one load
--   balancer name.
rtLoadBalancerNames :: Lens' RemoveTags [Text]

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
rtTags :: Lens' RemoveTags (NonEmpty TagKeyOnly)
data RemoveTagsResponse

-- | <a>RemoveTagsResponse</a> constructor.
removeTagsResponse :: RemoveTagsResponse
instance Eq RemoveTags
instance Read RemoveTags
instance Show RemoveTags
instance Eq RemoveTagsResponse
instance Ord RemoveTagsResponse
instance Read RemoveTagsResponse
instance Show RemoveTagsResponse
instance Generic RemoveTagsResponse
instance Datatype D1RemoveTagsResponse
instance Constructor C1_0RemoveTagsResponse
instance AWSRequest RemoveTags
instance ToHeaders RemoveTags
instance ToQuery RemoveTags
instance ToPath RemoveTags


-- | Adds the specified instances to the specified load balancer.
--   
--   The instance must be a running instance in the same network as the
--   load balancer (EC2-Classic or the same VPC). If you have EC2-Classic
--   instances and a load balancer in a VPC with ClassicLink enabled, you
--   can link the EC2-Classic instances to that VPC and then register the
--   linked EC2-Classic instances with the load balancer in the VPC.
--   
--   Note that <tt>RegisterInstanceWithLoadBalancer</tt> completes when the
--   request has been registered. Instance registration happens shortly
--   afterwards. To check the state of the registered instances, use
--   <tt>DescribeLoadBalancers</tt> or <tt>DescribeInstanceHealth</tt>.
--   
--   After the instance is registered, it starts receiving traffic and
--   requests from the load balancer. Any instance that is not in one of
--   the Availability Zones registered for the load balancer is moved to
--   the <tt>OutOfService</tt> state. If an Availability Zone is added to
--   the load balancer later, any instances registered with the load
--   balancer move to the <tt>InService</tt> state.
--   
--   If you stop an instance registered with a load balancer and then start
--   it, the IP addresses associated with the instance changes. Elastic
--   Load Balancing cannot recognize the new IP address, which prevents it
--   from routing traffic to the instances. We recommend that you use the
--   following sequence: stop the instance, deregister the instance, start
--   the instance, and then register the instance. To deregister instances
--   from a load balancer, use
--   <tt>DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Deregister and Register EC2 Instances</a>
--   in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
data RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer

-- | <a>RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>riwlbInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Instance</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>riwlbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer :: Text -> RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer

-- | The IDs of the instances.
riwlbInstances :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer [Instance]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
riwlbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer Text
data RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>riwlbrInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Instance</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse :: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The updated list of instances for the load balancer.
riwlbrInstances :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse [Instance]
instance Eq RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Read RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Show RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Eq RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Monoid RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Semigroup RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance FromXML RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance AWSRequest RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance ToHeaders RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance ToPath RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance IsList RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse


-- | Modifies the attributes of the specified load balancer.
--   
--   You can modify the load balancer attributes, such as
--   <tt>AccessLogs</tt>, <a>ConnectionDraining</a>, and
--   <a>CrossZoneLoadBalancing</a> by either enabling or disabling them.
--   Or, you can modify the load balancer attribute
--   <a>ConnectionSettings</a> by specifying an idle connection timeout
--   value for your load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see the following in the <i>Elastic Load
--   BalancingDeveloper Guide</i>:
--   
--   <a>Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a> <a>Connection Draining</a> <a>Access
--   Logs</a> <a>Idle ConnectionTimeout</a>
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
data ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes

-- | <a>ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mlbaLoadBalancerAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>LoadBalancerAttributes</a></li>
--   <li><a>mlbaLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
modifyLoadBalancerAttributes :: Text -> LoadBalancerAttributes -> ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes

-- | The attributes of the load balancer.
mlbaLoadBalancerAttributes :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | The name of the load balancer.
mlbaLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes Text
data ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse

-- | <a>ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mlbarLoadBalancerAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>LoadBalancerAttributes</a></li>
--   <li><a>mlbarLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
modifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse :: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
mlbarLoadBalancerAttributes :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse (Maybe LoadBalancerAttributes)

-- | The name of the load balancer.
mlbarLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance Read ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance Show ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance Eq ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
instance Read ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
instance Show ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
instance FromXML ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
instance AWSRequest ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance ToHeaders ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance ToQuery ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
instance ToPath ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes


-- | Adds the specified Availability Zones to the set of Availability Zones
--   for the specified load balancer.
--   
--   The load balancer evenly distributes requests across all its
--   registered Availability Zones that contain instances.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Add Availability Zone</a> in the
--   <i>Elastic LoadBalancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
data EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | <a>EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>eazflbAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>eazflbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer :: Text -> EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The Availability Zones. These must be in the same region as the load
--   balancer.
eazflbAvailabilityZones :: Lens' EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
eazflbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer Text
data EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>eazflbrAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse :: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The updated list of Availability Zones for the load balancer.
eazflbrAvailabilityZones :: Lens' EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse [Text]
instance Eq EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Ord EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Read EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Show EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Eq EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Ord EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Monoid EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Semigroup EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance FromXML EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance AWSRequest EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToHeaders EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToPath EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance IsList EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse


-- | Removes the specified Availability Zones from the set of Availability
--   Zones for the specified load balancer.
--   
--   There must be at least one Availability Zone registered with a load
--   balancer at all times. After an Availability Zone is removed, all
--   instances registered with the load balancer that are in the removed
--   Availability Zone go into the <tt>OutOfService</tt> state. Then, the
--   load balancer attempts to equally balance the traffic among its
--   remaining Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Disable an Availability Zone from a
--   Load-BalancedApplication</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
data DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | <a>DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dazflbAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dazflbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer :: Text -> DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The Availability Zones.
dazflbAvailabilityZones :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
dazflbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer Text
data DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dazflbrAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse :: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The remaining Availability Zones for the load balancer.
dazflbrAvailabilityZones :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse [Text]
instance Eq DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Ord DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Read DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Show DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Eq DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Ord DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Monoid DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance Semigroup DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance FromXML DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
instance AWSRequest DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToHeaders DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance ToPath DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance IsList DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse


-- | Removes the specified subnets from the set of configured subnets for
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   After a subnet is removed, all EC2 instances registered with the load
--   balancer in the removed subnet go into the <tt>OutOfService</tt>
--   state. Then, the load balancer balances the traffic among the
--   remaining routable subnets.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
data DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets

-- | <a>DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlbfsLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dlbfsSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
detachLoadBalancerFromSubnets :: Text -> DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets

-- | The name of the load balancer.
dlbfsLoadBalancerName :: Lens' DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets Text

-- | The IDs of the subnets.
dlbfsSubnets :: Lens' DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets [Text]
data DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse

-- | <a>DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlbfsrSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
detachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse :: DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse

-- | The IDs of the remaining subnets for the load balancer.
dlbfsrSubnets :: Lens' DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse [Text]
instance Eq DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance Ord DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance Read DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance Show DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance Eq DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance Ord DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance Read DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance Show DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance Monoid DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance Semigroup DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance FromXML DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse
instance AWSRequest DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance ToHeaders DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance ToQuery DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance ToPath DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
instance IsList DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse

-- | Describes the specified the load balancers. If no load balancers are
--   specified, the call describes all of your load balancers.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeLoadBalancers.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.DescribeLoadBalancers
data DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | <a>DescribeLoadBalancers</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlbLoadBalancerNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dlbMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dlbPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeLoadBalancers :: DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | The names of the load balancers.
dlbLoadBalancerNames :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers [Text]

-- | The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from
--   a previous call.)
dlbMarker :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return with this call (a number from
--   1 to 400). The default is 400.
dlbPageSize :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers (Maybe Natural)
data DescribeLoadBalancersResponse

-- | <a>DescribeLoadBalancersResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlbrLoadBalancerDescriptions</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>LoadBalancerDescription</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dlbrNextMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeLoadBalancersResponse :: DescribeLoadBalancersResponse

-- | Information about the load balancers.
dlbrLoadBalancerDescriptions :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancersResponse [LoadBalancerDescription]

-- | The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there
--   are no additional results, the string is empty.
dlbrNextMarker :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancersResponse (Maybe Text)

instance Ord DescribeLoadBalancers
instance Read DescribeLoadBalancers
instance Show DescribeLoadBalancers

instance ToPath DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | Describes the specified policies.
--   
--   If you specify a load balancer name, the action returns the
--   descriptions of all policies created for the load balancer. If you
--   specify a policy name associated with your load balancer, the action
--   returns the description of that policy. If you don't specify a load
--   balancer name, the action returns descriptions of the specified sample
--   policies, or descriptions of all sample policies. The names of the
--   sample policies have the 'ELBSample-' prefix.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeLoadBalancerPolicies.html</a>

-- | Deregisters the specified instances from the specified load balancer.
--   After the instance is deregistered, it no longer receives traffic from
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   You can use <tt>DescribeLoadBalancers</tt> to verify that the instance
--   is deregistered from the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Deregister and Register Amazon EC2
--   Instances</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer.html</a>

--   </ul>

diflbInstances :: Lens' DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer [Instance]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
diflbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer Text

-- | Deletes the specified load balancer.
--   
--   If you are attempting to recreate a load balancer, you must
--   reconfigure all settings. The DNS name associated with a deleted load
--   balancer are no longer usable. The name and associated DNS record of
--   the deleted load balancer no longer exist and traffic sent to any of
--   its IP addresses is no longer delivered to back-end instances.
--   
--   If the load balancer does not exist or has already been deleted, the
--   call to <a>DeleteLoadBalancer</a> still succeeds.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.DeleteLoadBalancer
data DeleteLoadBalancer

-- | <a>DeleteLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteLoadBalancer :: Text -> DeleteLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
dlbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' DeleteLoadBalancer Text
data DeleteLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>DeleteLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
deleteLoadBalancerResponse :: DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Eq DeleteLoadBalancer
instance Ord DeleteLoadBalancer
instance Read DeleteLoadBalancer
instance Show DeleteLoadBalancer
instance Monoid DeleteLoadBalancer
instance IsString DeleteLoadBalancer
instance Eq DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Ord DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Generic DeleteLoadBalancerResponse
instance Datatype D1DeleteLoadBalancerResponse

instance ToHeaders DeleteLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery DeleteLoadBalancer
instance ToPath DeleteLoadBalancer


-- | Creates a policy with the specified attributes for the specified load
--   balancer.
--   
--   Policies are settings that are saved for your load balancer and that
--   can be applied to the front-end listener or the back-end application
--   server, depending on the policy type.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLoadBalancerPolicy.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.CreateLoadBalancerPolicy
data CreateLoadBalancerPolicy

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancerPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clbpLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbpPolicyAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>PolicyAttribute</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clbpPolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbpPolicyTypeName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLoadBalancerPolicy :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateLoadBalancerPolicy

-- | The name of the load balancer.
clbpLoadBalancerName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerPolicy Text

-- | The attributes for the policy.
clbpPolicyAttributes :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerPolicy [PolicyAttribute]

-- | The name of the load balancer policy to be created. This name must be
--   unique within the set of policies for this load balancer.
clbpPolicyName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerPolicy Text

-- | The name of the base policy type. To get the list of policy types, use
--   <tt>DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes</tt>.
clbpPolicyTypeName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerPolicy Text
data CreateLoadBalancerPolicyResponse

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancerPolicyResponse</a> constructor.
createLoadBalancerPolicyResponse :: CreateLoadBalancerPolicyResponse

instance Read CreateLoadBalancerPolicy
instance Show CreateLoadBalancerPolicy

instance ToQuery CreateLoadBalancerPolicy
instance ToPath CreateLoadBalancerPolicy


-- | Creates one or more listeners for the specified load balancer. If a
--   listener with the specified port does not already exist, it is
--   created; otherwise, the properties of the new listener must match the
--   properties of the existing listener.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Add a Listener to Your Load Balancer</a>
--   in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLoadBalancerListeners.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.CreateLoadBalancerListeners
data CreateLoadBalancerListeners

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancerListeners</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clblListeners</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Listener</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clblLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLoadBalancerListeners :: Text -> CreateLoadBalancerListeners

-- | The listeners.
clblListeners :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerListeners [Listener]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
clblLoadBalancerName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerListeners Text
data CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse</a> constructor.
createLoadBalancerListenersResponse :: CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Eq CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance Read CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance Show CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance Eq CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Ord CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Read CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Show CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Generic CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateLoadBalancerListenersResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance ToHeaders CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance ToQuery CreateLoadBalancerListeners
instance ToPath CreateLoadBalancerListeners


-- | Creates a load balancer.
--   
--   If the call completes successfully, a new load balancer is created
--   with a unique Domain Name Service (DNS) name. The DNS name includes
--   the name of the AWS region in which the load balancer was created. For
--   example, the DNS name might end with either of the following:
--   
--   'us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com' 'us-west-2.elb.amazonaws.com' For
--   information about the AWS regions supported by Elastic Load Balancing,
--   see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   You can create up to 20 load balancers per region per account. You can
--   request an increase for the number of load balancers for your account.
--   For more information, see <a>Elastic Load Balancing Limits</a> in the
--   <i>Elastic LoadBalancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Elastic Load Balancing supports load balancing your EC2 instances
--   launched in either the EC2-Classic or EC2-VPC platform. For more
--   information, see <a>Elastic Load Balancing in EC2-Classic</a> or
--   <a>Elastic Load Balancing in a VPC</a> in the <i>Elastic Load
--   Balancing DeveloperGuide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.CreateLoadBalancer
data CreateLoadBalancer

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clbAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clbListeners</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Listener</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbScheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clbSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clbTags</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>NonEmpty</a> <a>Tag</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLoadBalancer :: Text -> NonEmpty Tag -> CreateLoadBalancer

-- | One or more Availability Zones from the same region as the load
--   balancer. Traffic is equally distributed across all specified
--   Availability Zones.
--   
--   You must specify at least one Availability Zone.
--   
--   You can add more Availability Zones after you create the load balancer
--   using <tt>EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</tt>.
clbAvailabilityZones :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | The listeners.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Listener Configurations for Elastic Load
--   Balancing</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
clbListeners :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer [Listener]

-- | The name of the load balancer.
--   
--   This name must be unique within your AWS account, must have a maximum
--   of 32 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or
--   hyphens, and cannot begin or end with a hyphen.
clbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer Text

-- | The type of a load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing creates an Internet-facing load
--   balancer with a publicly resolvable DNS name, which resolves to public
--   IP addresses. For more information about Internet-facing and Internal
--   load balancers, see <a>Internet-facing and Internal Load Balancers</a>
--   in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Specify <tt>internal</tt> to create an internal load balancer with a
--   DNS name that resolves to private IP addresses.
clbScheme :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The IDs of the security groups to assign to the load balancer.
clbSecurityGroups :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | The IDs of the subnets in your VPC to attach to the load balancer.
--   Specify one subnet per Availability Zone specified in
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt>.
clbSubnets :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | A list of tags to assign to the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information about tagging your load balancer, see
--   <a>Tagging</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
clbTags :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancer (NonEmpty Tag)
data CreateLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>CreateLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clbrDNSName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLoadBalancerResponse :: CreateLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
clbrDNSName :: Lens' CreateLoadBalancerResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateLoadBalancer
instance Read CreateLoadBalancer
instance Show CreateLoadBalancer
instance Eq CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance Ord CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance Monoid CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance FromXML CreateLoadBalancerResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateLoadBalancer
instance ToHeaders CreateLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery CreateLoadBalancer
instance ToPath CreateLoadBalancer


-- | Generates a stickiness policy with sticky session lifetimes controlled
--   by the lifetime of the browser (user-agent) or a specified expiration
--   period. This policy can be associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
--   
--   When a load balancer implements this policy, the load balancer uses a
--   special cookie to track the back-end server instance for each request.
--   When the load balancer receives a request, it first checks to see if
--   this cookie is present in the request. If so, the load balancer sends
--   the request to the application server specified in the cookie. If not,
--   the load balancer sends the request to a server that is chosen based
--   on the existing load-balancing algorithm.
--   
--   A cookie is inserted into the response for binding subsequent requests
--   from the same user to that server. The validity of the cookie is based
--   on the cookie expiration time, which is specified in the policy
--   configuration.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Duration-Based Session Stickiness</a> in
--   the <i>ElasticLoad Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
data CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | <a>CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clbcspCookieExpirationPeriod</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbcspLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clbcspPolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLBCookieStickinessPolicy :: Text -> Text -> CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If you do not specify this parameter, the sticky
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
clbcspCookieExpirationPeriod :: Lens' CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the load balancer.
clbcspLoadBalancerName :: Lens' CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy Text

-- | The name of the policy being created. This name must be unique within
--   the set of policies for this load balancer.
clbcspPolicyName :: Lens' CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy Text
data CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse

-- | <a>CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse</a> constructor.
createLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse :: CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Eq CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Ord CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Read CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Show CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Eq CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Ord CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Read CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Show CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Generic CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToHeaders CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToQuery CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToPath CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy


-- | Generates a stickiness policy with sticky session lifetimes that
--   follow that of an application-generated cookie. This policy can be
--   associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
--   
--   This policy is similar to the policy created by
--   <tt>CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy</tt>, except that the lifetime of
--   the special Elastic Load Balancing cookie, <tt>AWSELB</tt>, follows
--   the lifetime of the application-generated cookie specified in the
--   policy configuration. The load balancer only inserts a new stickiness
--   cookie when the application response includes a new application
--   cookie.
--   
--   If the application cookie is explicitly removed or expires, the
--   session stops being sticky until a new application cookie is issued.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Application-Controlled Session
--   Stickiness</a> in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
data CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | <a>CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cacspCookieName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cacspLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cacspPolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createAppCookieStickinessPolicy :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The name of the application cookie used for stickiness.
cacspCookieName :: Lens' CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy Text

-- | The name of the load balancer.
cacspLoadBalancerName :: Lens' CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy Text

-- | The name of the policy being created. This name must be unique within
--   the set of policies for this load balancer.
cacspPolicyName :: Lens' CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy Text
data CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse

-- | <a>CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse</a> constructor.
createAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse :: CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Eq CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Ord CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Read CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Show CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Eq CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Ord CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Read CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Show CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Generic CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicyResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToHeaders CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToQuery CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
instance ToPath CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy


-- | Specifies the health check settings to use when evaluating the health
--   state of your back-end instances.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Health Checks</a> in the <i>Elastic Load
--   BalancingDeveloper Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_ConfigureHealthCheck.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.ConfigureHealthCheck
data ConfigureHealthCheck

-- | <a>ConfigureHealthCheck</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>chcHealthCheck</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HealthCheck</a></li>
--   <li><a>chcLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
configureHealthCheck :: Text -> HealthCheck -> ConfigureHealthCheck

-- | The configuration information for the new health check.
chcHealthCheck :: Lens' ConfigureHealthCheck HealthCheck

-- | The name of the load balancer.
chcLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ConfigureHealthCheck Text
data ConfigureHealthCheckResponse

-- | <a>ConfigureHealthCheckResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>chcrHealthCheck</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>HealthCheck</a></li>
--   </ul>
configureHealthCheckResponse :: ConfigureHealthCheckResponse

-- | The updated health check.
chcrHealthCheck :: Lens' ConfigureHealthCheckResponse (Maybe HealthCheck)
instance Eq ConfigureHealthCheck
instance Read ConfigureHealthCheck
instance Show ConfigureHealthCheck
instance Eq ConfigureHealthCheckResponse
instance Read ConfigureHealthCheckResponse
instance Show ConfigureHealthCheckResponse
instance FromXML ConfigureHealthCheckResponse
instance AWSRequest ConfigureHealthCheck
instance ToHeaders ConfigureHealthCheck
instance ToQuery ConfigureHealthCheck
instance ToPath ConfigureHealthCheck


-- | Adds one or more subnets to the set of configured subnets for the
--   specified load balancer.
--   
--   The load balancer evenly distributes requests across all registered
--   subnets. For more information, see <a>Elastic Load Balancing in Amazon
--   VPC</a> in the <i>ElasticLoad Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
data AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets

-- | <a>AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>albtsLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>albtsSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
attachLoadBalancerToSubnets :: Text -> AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets

-- | The name of the load balancer.
albtsLoadBalancerName :: Lens' AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets Text

-- | The IDs of the subnets to add for the load balancer. You can add only
--   one subnet per Availability Zone.
albtsSubnets :: Lens' AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets [Text]
data AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse

-- | <a>AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>albtsrSubnets</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
attachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse :: AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse

-- | The IDs of the subnets attached to the load balancer.
albtsrSubnets :: Lens' AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse [Text]
instance Eq AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance Ord AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance Read AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance Show AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance Eq AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance Ord AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance Read AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance Show AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance Monoid AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance Semigroup AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance FromXML AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse
instance AWSRequest AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance ToHeaders AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance ToQuery AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance ToPath AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
instance IsList AttachLoadBalancerToSubnetsResponse


-- | Associates one or more security groups with your load balancer in a
--   virtual private cloud (VPC). The specified security groups override
--   the previously associated security groups.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Manage Security Groups for Amazon VPC</a>
--   in the <i>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
data ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer

-- | <a>ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>asgtlbLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asgtlbSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
applySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer :: Text -> ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
asgtlbLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups to associate with the load balancer.
--   Note that you cannot specify the name of the security group.
asgtlbSecurityGroups :: Lens' ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer [Text]
data ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>asgtlbrSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
applySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse :: ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The IDs of the security groups associated with the load balancer.
asgtlbrSecurityGroups :: Lens' ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse [Text]
instance Eq ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
instance Ord ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
instance Read ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
instance Show ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer

instance Read ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse
instance Monoid ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse
instance Semigroup ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse
instance FromXML ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse

instance ToQuery ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
instance ToPath ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
instance IsList ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancerResponse


-- | Adds the specified tags to the specified load balancer. Each load
--   balancer can have a maximum of 10 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a key and an optional value. If a tag with the
--   same key is already associated with the load balancer, <a>AddTags</a>
--   updates its value.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Tagging</a> in the <i>Elastic Load
--   Balancing DeveloperGuide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_AddTags.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ELB.AddTags
data AddTags

-- | <a>AddTags</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>atLoadBalancerNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>atTags</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>NonEmpty</a> <a>Tag</a></li>
--   </ul>
addTags :: NonEmpty Tag -> AddTags

-- | The name of the load balancer. You can specify one load balancer only.
atLoadBalancerNames :: Lens' AddTags [Text]

-- | The tags.
atTags :: Lens' AddTags (NonEmpty Tag)
data AddTagsResponse

-- | <a>AddTagsResponse</a> constructor.
addTagsResponse :: AddTagsResponse
instance Eq AddTags
instance Read AddTags
instance Show AddTags
instance Eq AddTagsResponse
instance Ord AddTagsResponse
instance Read AddTagsResponse
instance Show AddTagsResponse
instance Generic AddTagsResponse
instance Datatype D1AddTagsResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AddTagsResponse
instance AWSRequest AddTags
instance ToHeaders AddTags
instance ToQuery AddTags
instance ToPath AddTags


-- | Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application
--   traffic across multiple Amazon EC2 instances. It enables you to
--   achieve greater levels of fault tolerance in your applications,
--   seamlessly providing the required amount of load balancing capacity
--   needed to distribute application traffic.
module Network.AWS.ELB
